summary: This document is an email chain among Assistant United States Attorneys discussing a court-ordered declaration to explain disparities in discovery and counsel access between Ghislaine Maxwell (detained at MDC) and Justin Rivera (detained at MCC). The emails detail the differences in accommodations and the rationale based on housing situations and case specifics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused in a sex trafficking case, detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in protective custody, receiving extensive accommodations for discovery review and attorney visits.

persons.name: Justin Rivera
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking conspiracy, detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in general population, with lesser accommodations for discovery and counsel access compared to Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presiding over United States v. Rivera et al., raised concerns about disparities in treatment between Maxwell and Rivera and ordered a declaration from the BOP to explain the differences.

persons.name: Bhaskaran
persons.context: Primary author and correspondent in the email chain, coordinating the response to Judge Engelmayer's request regarding disparities in accommodations.

connections.description: Both are defendants in federal cases, with their treatment compared by the court regarding discovery and counsel access accommodations while in detention.
Judge Engelmayer is presiding over Rivera's case and has expressed frustration with the MCC's accommodations, ordering explanations for disparities.
Bhaskaran, as an AUSA, is preparing a declaration in response to Judge Engelmayer's order to explain the disparities in treatment between Maxwell and Rivera.

events.description: Deadline for the U.S. Attorney's Office to submit a declaration to Judge Engelmayer explaining disparities in accommodations between Maxwell and Rivera.

events.title: New Counsel Appointed for Rivera
events.description: Justin Rivera had new counsel appointed due to an irreconcilable breakdown with his former counsel.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell, detained at MDC in protective custody, had access to a laptop for 13 hours per day/7 days a week and 15 hours of weekly video counsel visits, while Justin Rivera at MCC in general population initially had only 3 hours of daily laptop access and 6 hours of weekly video visits.

Judge Engelmayer ordered the U.S. Attorney's Office to provide a declaration explaining the rationale for the disparities in accommodations, citing concerns about optics and potential discrimination based on race, gender, and class.

The disparities were attributed to Maxwell's unique housing situation (protective custody with sole access to a room), the larger volume of discovery in her case, and facility differences between MDC and MCC.

By the time of the email, the MCC had begun providing Rivera with all-day laptop access, matching Maxwell's electronic discovery access, but video conference access remained limited due to shared facility resources.
